(beat) But most of the time, even when  I'm with them... you know... It's  all about power, there's not much  room for actually getting to know  someone or having someone getting  to know you.

dialogues.text: Nell's face flushes with compassion.  With longing.  Marr her.  He's vulnerable.  Needing.  She doesn't dare hope. lasts a few heartbeats. He looks away. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this?  Why are you doing  this?  I don't know any of you.   You don't know me.  Why are you  doing this to me?

dialogues.text: I didn't do it.

dialogues.text: You could have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So could you!  Is this some fucked  up idea of art, putting someone  else's name to a painting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo... Did you?

dialogues.text: Maybe you did it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  You've been alone  for a long time, maybe you want  attention. (pointing to  Marrow) Maybe he did it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.  You know that, Nell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is horrifying to Nell, being doubted and accused of so ugly if it were true.

She peers up at the Hous roofline, its clusters of misplaced windows and other fea so many screaming heads. Chilled, she pulls her sweater closer.  Marrow comes out balcony from twin French doors behind her.

dialogues.text: Are you coming to confess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I were.  I wish I had done  it, then I could confess and you'd  be at peace.  That great moral  philosopher Frank Sinatra once  said to someone he loved, I wish  you had an enemy, so I could beat  him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say it wasn't you.  Who did  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a stupid thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was.

dialogues.text: (for the absurdity  of the idea) Welcome Home.

It takes her breath away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... it's so beautiful...

dialogues.text: Nell makes her way among the plants.  She looks up at a T DOUBLE-HELIX STAIRCASE which rises from the floor to a pl which gives access to the roof.  Below the staircase are filled with violets. NELL (cont'd) Violets.  Somebody must've died  here.

dialogues.text: And then, out of the corners, comes Mister Dudley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where she hanged herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rene Crain.  Up there.  Rope.   Ship's hawser.  Hard to tie.   Don't know how she got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, Mister Dudley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mister Dudley,  please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House is full of stories.  If you  know how to read these things,  it's an open book.  Just a  different library than the kind  you're used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.text: Why'd she kill herself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (what other reason  is there?) She was unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't say.  Haven't been here that  long. (he's off) Well, it's Labor Day, gotta get to  work.

dialogues.text: And off he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a horrible story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I was just thinking how happy I am  right now.  All my life, I've been  waiting for an adventure.  And I  thought, oh, I'll never have that,  adventures are for people who  travel long distances, that's for  soldiers, that's for the women  that the bullfighters fall in love  with.  And here I am, and  something is happening to me.   Strange noises in the night.   Paintings are calling to me.  And  all it cost to get there was five  gallons of gas.  I'm getting my  adventure.
